;;网络设备制造商思科系统公司的徽标出现在 2022 年 2 月 28 日西班牙巴塞罗那举行的 GSMA 2022 世界移动大会 (MWC) 上.REUTERS/Nacho Doce;
;

;思科系统;(CSCO. O); 周四同意收购网络安全公司 Splunk ;(SPLK.O); 以约 280 亿美元的价格收购，这是其有史以来最大规模的收购，将增强其网络安全业务。

;

;思科的现金收购价为每股 157 美元，较 Splunk 周三收盘价溢价约 31%。

;

; p>;

;两家公司在一份联合声明中表示：“思科和 Splunk 合并后将成为全球最大的软件公司之一，并将加速思科的业务转型，实现更多经常性收入。”

;

;思科股票盘前下跌近 5%，而 Splunk 股票的交易也被暂停。

;

;该交易获得了思科和 Splunk 董事会的一致批准，预计将于 2019 年第三季度末完成。 2024 年有待监管部门批准。

;

;Tidal Partners、Simpson Thacher & Bartlett 和 Cravath, Swaine & Moore 是思科的顾问。 Qatalyst Partners、摩根士丹利和世达律师事务所为 Splunk 提供咨询服务。

; Thu, 21 Sep 2023 20:25:04 +0800 Thousands of Greeks rally as state workers strike over labour law planshttps://reuters.com/article/greece-strike/thousands-of-greeks-rally-as-state-workers-strike-over-labour-law-plans-idUSKBN30R0IL
;;2023-09-21T11:50:11Z;
;

;周四，数千名希腊公共部门工作人员，包括教师、医生和运输人员，在雅典举行罢工，抗议反对6 月再次当选的保守党政府计划修改劳动法。

;

;总理基里亚科斯·米佐塔基斯 (Kyriakos Mitsotakis) 政府表示，此次改革将消除未申报的工作并促进整体就业，但工会和反对派表示这是对工人权利的侵犯，会创造野蛮的条件。

;

;希腊最大的公共部门工会 ADEDY 发起的为期一天的全国罢工是米佐塔基斯政府连任第二任期以来的首次罢工。

;

;火车和公共汽车的服务减少，州立医院配备了紧急人员，许多学校关闭。

;

;抗议者游行到议会，议员们正在辩论计划中的改革，预计这些改革将发生将于本周通过。米托塔基斯政府在 300 个席位的议会中拥有 158 名议员。

;

;代表约 50 万工人的 ADEDY 在其网站上表示，“我们要求撤回该法案”。

;

;该法案将允许全职员工获得兼职第二份工作，每天工作最多 13 个小时，除非存在某些条款，例如利益冲突。它还使雇主能够实施每周六天的工作制。

;

;“这为我们敞开了大门，可以工作多达 13 小时（每天），直到我们 74 岁，”Lambrini Christoyanni 说，代表农业部雇员的工会主席。 “这也结束了工人加薪的要求——他们应得的加薪。”

;

;根据该法案，员工可以在工作的第一年内被解雇，无需警告或报酬，除非双方同意。否则。

;

;它允许最长六个月的试用期，但也要求雇主提供详细的工作条款。

;

;如果出现以下情况，雇主将面临最高 10,500 欧元（11,175 美元）的罚款：他们没有宣布员工延长工作时间或换班。

;

;该法案还对那些在罢工期间阻碍员工工作的人处以罚款和六个月监禁。

;< p>;主要反对党、预计将于周日选举新领导人的激进左翼联盟的议员本周早些时候表示，政府正在推行针对工人的“秘密议程”。

;

;希腊共产党KKE 称该法案十分可怕。

;

;（1 美元 = 0.9396 欧元）

; Thu, 21 Sep 2023 19:55:03 +0800 Libya floods sweep away migrants, and their hopeshttps://reuters.com/article/libya-storm-syrians/libya-floods-sweep-away-migrants-and-their-hopes-idUSKBN30R0W2
;;2023-09-21T11:39:35Z;
;

;在经历溺水风险后，德尔纳的一楼小公寓成为叙利亚移民阿马尔·卡南的家外之家阻止他尝试危险的地中海穿越欧洲，这导致了许多人丧生。

;

;两年前逃离叙利亚以避免服兵役后，卡南在利比亚的一家糕点店找到了一份稳定的工作。与两名苏丹室友住在距离德尔纳河床几米远的地方。

;

;但本月，一场山洪冲毁了城市的大片地区，这位 19 岁的年轻人与数千人一起溺水身亡。

;

; p>;

;现在，他的建筑曾经所在的地块已经变成了一片红棕色的泥土，那些依靠遥远海岸的人养家糊口的家庭陷入了震惊，没有尸体可埋葬。

;

;“他没有喜欢大海。大海来找他，”卡南的叔叔奥萨马说，他今年只有 24 岁，从叙利亚搬到了利比亚城市班加西。 “他死了，被压死了，淹死了。”

;

;独裁者穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲在北约支持的起义中被推翻十多年后，利比亚已成为一个主要的;试图穿越欧洲的移民的出发点;。

;

;但许多人也留下来在利比亚石油公司工作- 金融经济。

;

;国际移民组织表示，洪水来袭时，德尔纳居住着 8,000 多名移民，其中大部分来自乍得、埃及和苏丹。

;

;估计有 400 名< a href="/world/africa/un-says-death-toll-libya-floods-includes-400-migrants-2023-09-19/">;移民;于 9 月 10 日晚死亡，丹尼尔风暴的暴雨冲破了两座原本旨在保持;Derna 安全;。

;

;卡南 17 岁时离开叙利亚，决心避免在这个经历了 12 年战争的国家服兵役。随着叙利亚经济持续下滑，他希望在国外找到一份工作可以帮助他向位于南部德拉省的父母寄钱。

;

;到达欧洲几乎是不可能的壮举，而土耳其的物价太高，而且难以航行，所以他定居在利比亚。

;

;从那里出发，乘坐小艇前往欧洲曾吸引过他，“但他的父母拒绝了，因为他们认为他会淹死，”奥萨马说。

;

; p>;

;19 岁时，Kanaan 在糕点店工作，每月赚取 500 美元，并向家人发送他烘焙的蛋糕的照片。

;

;9 月 10 日下雨时，他给 Osama 发短信，“上帝帮助我们，这是最好的事情。”几分钟后，接下来的消息仍未被阅读。到了早上，奥萨马的 WhatsApp 消息甚至还没有到达卡南的手机。

;

;61 岁的哈利勒是一位住在德尔纳的埃及技术人员，他记得看到强大的水流将汽车从地面上冲走，然后将它们撞向建筑物。他说：“我认识这里所有的埃及人，其中很多人都死了。”

;

;阿拉姆是一名在德尔纳工作了三年的埃及建筑工人，他说他在这场事故中失去了 10 名朋友。灾难。

;

;“这不是我们所知道的德尔纳。整个市中心都消失了，”他告诉路透社。

;

;叙利亚人权观察站，一家总部位于英国的监测跟踪机构叙利亚战争和其他与叙利亚人有关的事件估计有超过 110 名叙利亚人在洪水中丧生。

;

;几个小时之内，利比亚叙利亚人用来寻找工作的 Facebook 页面就变成了寻找失踪人员的在线搜索队伍。仍然下落不明的男人、女人，甚至幼儿的照片配上绝望的求助请求和电话号码。

;

;但几天之内，常见的信息又开始出现：一名叙利亚男子询问工资。利比亚城市的理发师，一名妇女为朋友寻求住房参考。一些带有提示的评论。其他人只是写，“不要来。”

;

;根据 CME 的 FedWatch 工具，交易员对 11 月和 12 月基准利率保持不变的押注分别为 71% 和 53% .

;

;投资者还将关注经济数据，包括8月份每周失业救济金申请和成屋销售数据，以获取有关利率轨迹和经济状况的线索。

;

;与此同时，;近期上市;的表现疲弱他们的首次亮相高点增加了人们对首次公开募股市场复苏希望的怀疑，因为高利率和更广泛的市场下跌可能会继续产生影响。

;

;;阿塞拜疆周四（9 月 21 日）开始与来自纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚族人进行谈判，此前该地区被迫投降，引发亚美尼亚总理尼科尔·帕希尼扬 (Nikol Pashinyan) 辞职的呼声。;
;

;阿塞拜疆周四开始与来自纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚族人进行谈判，此前该地区被迫投降，这引发了要求亚美尼亚总理尼科尔·帕辛扬辞职的呼声。

;

;发送给路透社的照片显示，两国官员双方坐在阿塞拜疆耶夫拉赫市的一个小圆桌旁。

;

;阿塞拜疆总统伊利哈姆·阿利耶夫周三表示，他的“铁拳”已经让亚美尼亚卡拉巴赫独立的想法成为历史。

;

;卡拉巴赫亚美尼亚人表示，在阿利耶夫的军队在 24 小时的进攻中突破了阿塞拜疆的防线后，他们别无选择，只能接受阿塞拜疆的条件。

;

;卡拉巴赫主要城市（亚美尼亚人称之为斯捷潘纳克特）的亚美尼亚当局阿塞拜疆人致电汉肯迪，称周四该市发生枪声，消息人士告诉路透社，他们听到了枪声。

;

;卡拉巴赫当局指责阿塞拜疆军队违反停火协议，并建议居民留在室内。

;

;卡拉巴赫当局指责阿塞拜疆军队违反停火协议，并建议居民留在室内。 p>;

;巴库国防部表示，有关其部队袭击汉肯迪的报道“完全是虚假的，其目的是散布虚假信息”。

;

;根据阿塞拜疆概述的停火协议，脱离的亚美尼亚军队必须解散并解除武装，该地区 12 万人将完全融入阿塞拜疆。

;

;巴库表示，议会成员拉明·马梅多夫 (Ramin Mammadov) 代表巴库出席了在叶夫拉赫举行的会谈。卡拉巴赫亚美尼亚人的发言人多次没有接听电话。

;

;阿塞拜疆的迅速胜利代表了数十年来重新控制卡拉巴赫的斗争的高潮，卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚族人在 20 世纪 90 年代的一场重大战争中分裂了。随着苏联的解体。

;

;阿利耶夫在向全国发表的讲话中表示：“在犯罪军政府投降后，这种紧张局势的根源、这个毒巢已经成为历史。”周三晚上，他将愤怒集中在卡拉巴赫的领导层上。

;

;“卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚人终于可以松一口气了。我之前说过，我想重复一遍：卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚人我们的公民。”

;

;阿利耶夫说，“战犯”试图毒害卡拉巴赫亚美尼亚人的思想，他说，他们的宗教和文化权利现在将受到尊重。

;

;但是尽管如此，仍有数千人聚集在斯捷潘纳克特机场，而其他人则在俄罗斯维和人员的庇护下避难。

;

;阿塞拜疆的胜利是纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫山区动荡历史的又一个转折，几个世纪以来，纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫一直处于波斯人的统治之下，土耳其人、俄罗斯人、奥斯曼人和苏联人，以及亚美尼亚人和阿塞拜疆人已经冲突了一个多世纪。

;

;这还可能改变南高加索地区微妙的权力平衡，该地区是一个由多个国家和地区组成的地区。俄罗斯、美国、土耳其和伊朗正在争夺影响力。

;

;该领土被亚美尼亚人称为阿尔扎赫，国际上公认是主要穆斯林阿塞拜疆的一部分，但其亚美尼亚居民是基督徒。< /p>;

;阿塞拜疆表示卡拉巴赫亚美尼亚人同意的停火将导致亚美尼亚在阿塞拜疆境内建立一个独立实体的斗争的失败，尽管目前尚不清楚该协议在卡拉巴赫有多少支持。< /p>;

;US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy will try to restart his stalled Republican spending agenda on Thursday, with a procedural vote on a fiscal 2024 defense appropriations bill that Republicans have already twice failed to advance.

;

;A vote to open debate on the $886 billion measure is expected in the House of Representatives, a day after McCarthy's fractious majority met in a ;2-1/2-hour closed-door meeting; aimed at finding common ground on legislation to avert a government shutdown in barely a week and half.

;

;"We're going to be voting," McCarthy told reporters late on Wednesday. "I think we've got a plan to move forward."

;

;McCarthy said Republicans were also "very close" on a short-term funding measure known as a continuing resolution, or CR, and predicted that he would be able to advance other longer-term spending legislation.

;

;To avert a government shutdown on Oct. 1, the House and the Democratic-led Senate must agree on short- or long-term spending legislation that Democratic President Joe Biden can then sign into law. But the partisan measures that Republicans hope to begin passing soon face stiff opposition from Democrats in the Senate and from the White House.

;

;The Republican spending agenda had run afoul of a small group of ;Republican hardline conservatives;, who wanted assurances that fiscal 2024 appropriations will not exceed a 2022 top line of $1.47 trillion - $120 billion less than McCarthy and Biden agreed to in May.

;

;On Tuesday McCarthy had to pull a procedural vote on a proposed 30-day CR.随后，关于国防拨款法案的公开辩论投票失败。 The defense bill had already been delayed earlier in the month.

;

;The Republican stalemate raised concerns about the ability of Congress to keep federal agencies afloat when current funding expires on Sept. 30.

;

;But McCarthy told reporters on Wednesday that he had been able to win support from two of the five hardliners who had joined Democrats to oppose the defense appropriations bill on Tuesday. With a narrow 221-212 majority, McCarthy can afford to lose no more than four votes on measures opposed by Democrats.

;

;The two hardliners appear to have changed their positions after McCarthy proposed a 30-day CR that would cut spending to the 2022 level, according to two sources familiar with the discussion. The CR would include a commission to tackle the federal debt and conservative restrictions on immigration and the border.

;

;McCarthy's proposal would also set a top line for full-year fiscal 2024 spending at just under $1.53 trillion, the sources said.

;

;It was not clear how much support the CR or the 2024 top line would draw from House Republicans.

;

;But McCarthy sounded an optimistic note on the CR.

;

;"We're very close," he said. "I feel like I've just got a little more movement to go there."

;

;NextEra Energy's $5.4 billion retirement plan for employees has suffered about half a billion dollars in losses this year as outsized bets on company stock soured, reflecting ongoing risks of corporate 401(k) policies that encourage concentrated positions in company shares.

;

;America's largest renewable power company is among several US energy and utility companies, including Exxon and Southern Company, that continue to promote big, concentrated bets on company stock in worker retirement plans.

;

;A Reuters analysis of retirement policies and stock performance data, along with interviews with retirement and finance experts, show a small but prominent corner of Corporate America still plays a risky game with company stock in employee benefit plans even after high-profile corporate implosions like the $63 billion Enron collapse.

;

;Nearly 50% of the investments in NextEra's employee-funded 401(k) retirement plan are in company stock, the highest among all 30 companies in the S&P 500 Utilities Sector ;(.SPLRCU);. The total company stock balance across the index is $13 billion, or 14% of $90.4 billion in investments, according to a Reuters analysis of 2022 financial statements.

;

;NextEra's strategy, ill advised by financial advisers and out of favor in most corporate 401(k) plans, generates tax deductions for corporate headquarters while workers shoulder all the risk of a concentrated position in a single stock.

;

;By contrast, 92% of US employee retirement accounts contain no home-company stock, with many companies either not offering their shares for those plans or limiting them, according to a Vanguard Group study of 2022 allocations by 5 million 401(k) participants.

;

;NextEra ;(NEE.N); policies incentivize workers to invest retirement funds in its shares. It has no limit on how much employees can allocate to company stock, matches worker contributions in company shares instead of cash, and gives workers the option to reinvest dividends on those holdings into even more stock, according to the retirement plan's financial statements.

;

;NextEra declined to comment on its use of company stock in employee 401(k) plans. "We have nothing to offer," a company spokesperson said.

;

;Not diversifying "is a crazy thing to do,” said Alicia Munnell, director of the Center for Retirement Research at Boston College. “If things go really badly at your company, you can lose your job and your retirement savings.”

;

;NextEra's reliance on its shares has paid off big for workers over the past ten years as the company grew rapidly, delivering a total return of 325%, compared to the S&P 500's return of 212%.

;

;But employees have been stung more recently as higher interest rates increased the cost of the company's ambitious roll out of wind and solar energy. Utility stock dividend yields also look less attractive to investors in a higher interest rate environment.

;

;Since the end of 2021, NextEra shares have slumped 27%, compared to a 11% decline on the S&P 500 Utilities Index, slashing the value of employees' NextEra shares by more than $500 million, according to the plan's financial statements.

;

;Last year, employees booked nearly $66 million in actual losses from selling shares, financial reports show.

;

;Enron's $2.14 billion retirement plan had 62% of its assets invested in the company's common and preferred stock at the end of 2000, months before it went bust. Employees took massive losses because they were prohibited from selling their shares amid disclosures of deepening financial problems, and then they lost their jobs.

;

;More recently, SVB Financial Corp's bankruptcy in March after the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, erased nearly all of the value of the parent company's stock.

;

;Kristin McKenna, president of Darrow Wealth Management in suburban Boston, said many times her new clients are unaware of the concentrated positions in their retirement accounts.

;

;"It's the rule, not the exception," McKenna said. "If we saw a concentration of more than 20% in a single company stock, we would definitely tell them it's a big risk."

;

;In recent years, many US publicly-traded corporations have imposed limits on the concentration of company shares in retirement plans and offer more diversified plans that include inexpensive target-date funds, which automatically allocate stocks and bonds based on investors' age and dial down risk as they approach retirement.

;

;But there are a number of large, noteworthy holdouts in the energy and utility sectors, SEC disclosures show.

;

;Exxon's retirement savings plan held $8.4 billion in company stock at the end of 2022, or 40% of $21.1 billion in total investments.与更加多元化的投资组合相比，这一押注一直落后。 Exxon's total return of 101% trails the broader S&P 500 Index's 212% return over the past decade.

;

;Exxon declined to comment.

;

;Employee retirement plans overweight with stock help companies by providing a tax-break opportunity for headquarters.例如，公司可以扣除员工退休账户中持有的公司股票所支付的股息。 This is most helpful to companies in the utility and energy sectors, which have among the highest dividend payouts and the highest concentration of home-grown stock in their 401(k) plans.

;

;Few companies disclose the impact of those tax deductions, but the ones that do say the impact is large enough to cut their 21% federal tax rate, according to filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission.

;

;Southern Co ;(SO.N);, for example, has reduced its tax rate by as much as 4 percentage points in recent years.美国证券交易委员会披露的信息显示，截至 2022 年底，这家总部位于佐治亚州亚特兰大的公用事业公司的 76.5 亿美元退休计划中，有 38% 投资于公司股票。 The company did not return messages seeking comment.

;

;In 2021, Dominion Energy Inc ;(DE.N); placed a 20% limit on company stock holdings in its retirement plan for salaried employees, part of a commitment to diversification, said company spokesperson Ryan Frazier.

;

;Nevertheless, recent losses in the Dominion plan have been heavy.截至去年底，该计划持有的 Dominion 股票价值 6.87 亿美元，占 39 亿美元资产的 18%。 SEC 披露的信息显示，这些股票的成本基础为 7.58 亿美元，这意味着员工损失了 7100 万美元。 Since then, Dominion's share price has dropped 22%. `

;

;Keith Rasmussen, a retired geologist, said he still feels the financial repercussions of holding big bets on company stock in his retirement plans.

;

;His first jolt came during a short stint at the oil and gas arm of Enron, when he sold several thousand shares at $5 apiece. Those shares had an average value of $35 when he received them, he said.

;

;And then more than a decade later, Rasmussen took heavy losses when a drop in natural gas prices crushed the value of his retirement plan holdings in Chesapeake Energy Corp, whose retirement plan held 46% of its assets in company stock at the end of 2013.

;

;“My 401(k) was cut in half,” Rasmussen, 68, recalled in a telephone interview. “We can pay our bills, but we're restricted a little bit on things we wanted to do and planned on doing.”

; Thu, 21 Sep 2023 18:25:04 +0800 Americans broadly support auto, Hollywood strikes -Reuters/Ipsos pollhttps://reuters.com/article/autos-labor-uaw-poll/americans-broadly-support-auto-hollywood-strikes-reuters-ipsos-poll-idUSKBN30R0PK
;;2023-09-21T10:10:56Z;
;

;Americans broadly back striking workers in the auto industry and Hollywood, according to a two-day Reuters/Ipsos poll completed on Wednesday that found significant support among both Democrats and Republicans.

;

;The poll found that 58% of Americans support the first-ever simultaneous strike by the ;United Auto Workers; union against Ford Motor ;(FN);, General Motors ;(GM.N); and Chrysler parent Stellantis ;(STLAM.MI); to win better pay and benefits, while 32% oppose the action and 10% were unsure.

;

;Similarly, 60% of Americans support the dual ;strikes by screenwriters; and actors to win better pay and protections in the entertainment industry, while 27% oppose it and 13% were unsure.

;

;The poll found especially strong support among Democrats, who have traditionally allied with labor unions. Some 72% of self-identified Democrats said they backed the auto workers strike and 79% said they supported the Hollywood strike.

;

;A large number of Republicans also said they backed the striking workers, even though their party has traditionally advanced pro-business policies and taken a skeptical view of the liberal views espoused by many Hollywood celebrities.

;

;The poll found that 48% of Republicans backed the auto workers strike, while 47% opposed it. Similarly, 46% said they supported the Hollywood strikes and 46% said they did not.

;

;That divide has been reflected in the battle for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination. Former President Donald Trump, who leads the field by a wide margin, plans to skip the next candidates' debate on Sept. 27 and ;instead give a speech; to auto workers and other blue-collar union members.

;

;Other candidates like Nikki Haley and Tim Scott have said the auto workers are ;asking for too much;.

;

;Democratic President Joe Biden, who has sided with the UAW and called on auto companies to concede more to striking workers, has made union outreach a central part of his 2024 reelection bid. He won 57% of union households in the 2020 election, compared with 40% for Trump, according to Edison Research.

;

;The poll comes as the United States has seen an ;uptick in union activism;. Through August -- before the UAW strike -- 310,000 US workers were involved in work stoppages, putting 2023 on track to become the busiest year for strikes since 2019.

;

;The poll also found broad support for the labor movement in general, even though private-sector union membership remains at historical lows in the United States.

;

;Some 61% of respondents said labor unions have improved the quality of life for all Americans, while only 35% said labor unions were no longer necessary.

;

;Two-thirds said pay for CEOs and workers should go up equally -- a central talking point of the UAW strike.

;

;The online poll of 1,005 US adults was conducted between Sept. 19 and Sept. 20. It has a margin of error of plus or minus 4 percentage points, and 6 percentage points for Democratic and Republican responses.
